medical_history.chief_complaint: Mental-status changes, diarrhea, renal insufficiency, diabetic ketoacidosis, and hypotension.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 2 months before admission with increasing fatigue, somnolence, and intermittent mild confusion, accompanied by diarrhea and decreasing glycemic control. Three weeks prior to admission, he experienced increasing orthopnea and paroxysmal nocturnal dyspnea. During the weeks leading to admission, his ability to care for himself declined, oral intake decreased, and diarrhea increased in frequency.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus, chronic renal failure, history of renal transplantation 9 years ago, congestive heart failure, hypertension, hypothyroidism, peripheral vascular disease, chronic interstitial lung disease, and a history of urinary tract infection treated with levofloxacin.
medical_history.family_history: Children are healthy; other relatives have thyroid disease and diabetes mellitus.
medical_history.social_history: Smoked cigarettes, drank alcohol occasionally, and lived in a desert region of the southwestern United States for 8 years before returning to the Northeast 7 months prior to admission.
